message: If you try the free version and like it, you can get the pro version for free -- post a review (of the free version) in the itunes store and PM me which review is yours, and I will send you a promo code for the pro version (no matter what rating you give).
if i rsync music will it added it to my itunes library?
first off, congrats on launching. definitely interesting project. and still has that 'beta' feel, imho.

a few UI input, 1. I think your back button is using 'undo' icon...
2. have the option sync a file... or at least list the files inside the folder before syncing...
3. i don't think your ad system is working, or maybe it's not working here in Aus. I'm just getting a banner saying 'upgrade to acrosync pro to remove ads.' no actual ads.
@acrosync also do you think you could add icons to the side of a filename or folder, to show it is a file or folder
@italiano40 No it can't export music to the itunes library.
@unwrangle 1) I need to rework the icons; 2) will have this in ver2.0; 3) I'm using iAds, which is available only in US and UK and maybe a few other countries.

@italiano40 did you mean the directory list after the login window?  right now only directories are listed there; when it is updated to include files, yes, file/folder icons will be added to the side.
I ask because I've used rsync in a (windows) app for a client, and controlling it and interpreting its output was a giant PITA.
Looks cool; I'm curious, did you write your own rsync client library? I didn't think you could start new processes on iOS? (and rsync itself is GPL, so linking against it is a no-no)
So if you've come up with a clean solution I'm sure other developers would be interested in it as a library!

Really like the app. Went from free to pro although ads were definitely unobtrusive, I want to show my support for your efforts. One issue, can't delete files after sync. The "X" only stops a sync in progress. Is there a fix did I overlook something?
